Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip, now much darkened, and the Register records the presence of very faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:30-31 House T36.44 I.23
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393619) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393619)
